channel.title: Have you ever wondered how your character feels?
channel.description: Have you ever wondered how your character feels? You just clicking him around everywhere, poor guy. He probably thinks in his head, "This little b---ard, always clicking me around in these f-cking dumb places. Freaking wanna kill the guy!"

item.title: Have you ever wondered how your character feels?
item.dc:creator: @kronixz kronikz
item.description:
@kronixz wrote:

zyle1992:

Honestly, the character would probably think that their actions were their own, because they couldn’t know who’s controlling them. I mean, how do we know that we’re not being controlled?

then I must be a lazy ass character

Read full topic
item.source: Have you ever wondered how your character feels?

item.title: Have you ever wondered how your character feels?
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

imsuperman05:

or maybe we’re in an abandoned building talking to ourselves and your whole life is just in your mind

Ive had feeling of this before. Its so weird but interesting. These kinds of ideas is being put into movies more and more. Like at the end of the movie called Repo Men. The main character Saves countless lives, gets the girl, and live a good life. But we come to find out he is hooked up to a life preserver that implements a happly unrealistic life into his head. I know i just spoiled the ending to the movie but its still worth a watch for anyone who hasn’t seen it,

Read full topic
item.source: Have you ever wondered how your character feels?

item.title: Have you ever wondered how your character feels?
item.dc:creator: @poopler40 poopler40
item.description:
@poopler40 wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:11, topic:446704”][quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=549594.msg4028714#msg4028714 date=1340560192]

Honestly, the character would probably think that their actions were their own, because they couldn’t know who’s controlling them. I mean, how do we know that we’re not being controlled?

I thought of this last night, what if the government is secretly getting us high so were less sophisticated and unaware of things that they are so we’re easier to control?! or something…
[/quote]

I read a short story once about a society where the government does this. They would give people who were smarter, or stronger handicaps to slow them down, like weights, or an earpiece that stopped them from thinking about something for more than a given amount of time.[/quote]

Ive read it too. It was at school during one of those passage reading test.

Read full topic

item.title: Have you ever wondered how your character feels?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

[quote=“vManlyMan, post:11, topic:446704”][quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=549594.msg4028714#msg4028714 date=1340560192]

Honestly, the character would probably think that their actions were their own, because they couldn’t know who’s controlling them. I mean, how do we know that we’re not being controlled?

I thought of this last night, what if the government is secretly getting us high so were less sophisticated and unaware of things that they are so we’re easier to control?! or something…
[/quote]

I read a short story once about a society where the government does this. They would give people who were smarter, or stronger handicaps to slow them down, like weights, or an earpiece that stopped them from thinking about something for more than a given amount of time.[/quote]
Really? It’s crazy to think about, we could all be basically mentally handicapped for all we know to be kept in the dark.
Inserting chips into our rectum and brains as baby’s, monitoring our every action.
